commentary_data: " The first chants of Dhoni-Dhoni!" says a relieved Kaushik who's made it into the stadium at last. Meanwhile, the opening ceremony is about to begin in front of a packed crowd.
Didn't expect to see so much yellow in Motera!
No matter whatever the stadium may be, CSK fans are the majority :)

"More yellow than blue in this stadium that's now almost 90% full," confirms Kaushik. "A volunteer, possibly on instruction from some Titans marketing guy, is frantically distributing Blue Titans flag, even to those wearing the CSK kits! Job pressure." Whatever their team colour, the crowd is currently singing along with Arijit Singh. Rivalries aside for now.
Hari agree with that, but there is definitely an exception in Chinnaswamy Stadium. Its all a red wave there.
The most successful captain of India vs the future captain of India..The Ahmedabad crowd is on the threshold of Indian cricket.
Okay, let's get to the match on hand shall we. Nikhil Jadhav will take you through how these two teams stack up.

Two teams packed with quality all-rounders and proven perfomers over several seasons will face-off in the inaugural game of the season at the Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad. Gujarat Titans - the defending champions of IPL are ready to take on four-time IPL winners - Chennai Super Kings in front of their home crowd. The same venue where India and Australia played a Test match in the presence of their respective Prime Ministers not so long ago. Moeen Ali, Ben Stokes, Ravindra Jadeja - CSK have got a bank of reliable all-rounders, but for the Titans, it will be their captain - the ultimate game changer - Hardik Pandya, who will be raring to go once again. Not only did he play a crucial role in Gujarat's triumph as an all-rounder, but he also proved his mettle as a leader. Assembling a team from scratch and winning the tournament like IPL in their first ever attempt, hats-off to Gujarat's achievement.  There were different players who stepped in for Gujarat in different scenarios, and braved them out of trouble every single time. Will Pandya and his boys manage to repeat their heroics. Only time will tell..

"Looks like a belter of a wicket, there's a bit of grass covering on it, the surface is nice and hard. It has some good pace and bounce in it. The new ball might nip around a bit, so the opening batters will have a little bit of work cut out. The square boundaries are comparatively shorter as compared to the straighter ones. A great cricket surface and the outfield looks magnificent. The batters need to put up a good score on the board," reckons Simon Doull.
Having a Law exam tomorrow !!!! but who cares thinking of studying late at night and now just wanting to enjoy IPL
ujjwal ,Hari : Habibi , come to Wankhede..!! #WeBleedBlue

Huge roar from the crowd as MS Dhoni is seen on the big screen, grooving to the tunes of Arijit who is now on a car doing a lap around the stadium. Imagine the noise when Dhoni takes the field. It's mad out there.
vijay, study bro, that exam might decide ur life, all this is nothing but entertainment, keep this your last preference
MS showed on camera for just a few seconds and crowd went crazy. Arijit Singh wondering what just happened. :D

The performances are done, and it's time to welcome the captains on stage. And just listen to this. Massive roar as Dhoni makes his entry on top of a cart shaped like a chariot. Same for Pandya. They now pose in front of the trophy along with the BCCI office-bearers and other performers. Fireworks go off. With that, the opening ceremony is done. Time for cricket.

Toss will take place at 7.10pm. Dhoni and Pandya are already in the middle, greeting the match referee Javagal Srinath. Dhoni is now handed a couple of sheets with the lineups depending on how the toss goes, and he's going through them.
Right, time for the toss. Dhoni calls heads, it's a tails

We'll bowl first. It's always good to play here. New start, new season, quite exciting. Almost everyone in the country has got motivation from him (Dhoni). Been a fan and admirer of him. Want boys to enjoy it. Result will take care of itself. It's different - I've left it in the coach. Ashu pa works all night on what needs to be done. I don't know (combination for today).

Were also looking to bowl. Looks a good wicket and I don't think it will change. Don't know if there will be dew because it rained last night. You want to play in front of people. This stadium is twice the capacity of other stadiums. Fantastic atmohsphere. Preparation was good. We assembled quite early. It's a luxury to have (impact player). It becomes slightly easy to take the decision because you can use it at any time. Influence of allrounder has become slightly less because of the rule.
(Playing XI): Devon Conway, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Moeen Ali, Ben Stokes, Ambati Rayudu,  Shivam Dube, Ravindra Jadeja, MS Dhoni(w/c), Mitchell Santner, Deepak Chahar, Rajvardhan Hangargekar
(Playing XI): Wriddhiman Saha(w), Shubman Gill, Kane Williamson, Hardik Pandya(c), Vijay Shankar, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Mohammed Shami, Joshua Little, Yash Dayal, Alzarri Joseph
Excited to see the teams tactical thinking being put to the test and possibly out of their comfort zone with the Impact player rule.
The two teams walk out side by side, and then line up next to each other for the national anthem
Tushar Deshpande, Subhranshu Senapati, Shaik Rasheed, Ajinkya Rahane, Nishant Sindhu
B Sai Sudharsan, Jayant Yadav, Mohit Sharma, Abhinav Manohar, KS Bharat
"I did not see Captain's naming Impact Player's names during the toss. Is the impact player rule there in this IPL?" -- Impact player will be chosen from the five subs that are named
All set for play. Mohammed Shami has the ball, and facing him is Conway. Two slips in place. Here's Shami from round the wicket
Shami to Conway, no run, length ball slanted in on middle and leg, Conway hangs back and tucks it to midwicket

Shami to Conway, leg byes, 1 run, oh he gives charge and looks to whip it away into the on-side! A length ball slanted in around off, nips back in sharply, beats Conway's attempted flick and . It goes wide of the keeper who makes a half-stop diving across
Shami to Gaikwad, no run, back of a length on off, Gaikwad hangs back to defend but it straightens a touch. He gets a soft leading edge into the off-side
Shami to Gaikwad, 1 run, back of a length on off, Gaikwad hangs back and bunts it in front of mid-on for a quick single
Shami to Conway, no run, hard length delivery that angles onto off, defended back to Shami
Shami to Conway, no run, Beaten!! Length delivery that holds its line and does not swing from outside off. Conway had a poke and is beaten
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, , back of a length around middle, and it's been clipped away beautifully by Gaikwad! He hangs back and shows lovely wristwork to get it purring through midwicket
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, no run, good length on off, Gaikwad gets half-forward and defends
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, , lovely drive on the up for four! Slightly fuller than a good length just outside off, not a bad ball but Gaikwad gets forward and hits it crisply through point
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, 1 run, good length delivery slanted in at the stumps, Gaikwad gets forward and works it wide of mid-on
Hardik Pandya to Conway, 1 run, upwards of 141kph, back of a length delivery across off stump, and Conway chops it wide of backward point
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, 1 run, slower length ball just outside off, Gaikwad gets forward and knocks it in front of mid-on. They scamper through for one

Shami to Gaikwad, 1 run, 142.2kph, good length delivery outside off, Gaikwad looks to drive on the up but it nips away a touch, taking a thick edge that goes quickly to third man. There was a collective gasp from the crowd as it took the edge
Shami to Conway,  Bowled!!
Shami to Conway,  Bowled!!

Shami to Conway,  Bowled!!  who has made a mess of the stumps! Full, fast, slanted in from round the wicket. And it's a very loose drive from Conway. His front foot doesn't go anywhere, the ball nips in sharply, goes through the gate and clatters into middle and off.
Shami to Moeen Ali, no run, back of a length delivery that cuts in towards off, Moeen hangs back and defends to midwicket
Shami to Moeen Ali, no run, close to 140kph, good length outside off, Moeen throws his hands on the drive but is  as it nips away a touch
Shami to Moeen Ali, no run, 141.3kph, good length delivery slanted in on off, and Moeen is half-forward as he defends gently into the off-side
Shami to Moeen Ali, no run,  Short of length delivery slanted in, Moeen is cramped for room going for the cut and nearly plays on. The ball goes to short fine
Joshua Little to Gaikwad, ,  Short of length into the body, Gaikwad swivels across and pulls it over short fine. It sails over the ropes
Joshua Little to Gaikwad, , now he offers width and gets slapped through point! This absolutely flew off Gaikwad's bat! 10 off the first two balls of the over
Joshua Little to Gaikwad, 1 run, misfield from Pandya! Good length on off, Gaikwad drives on the up to mid-off where Pandya's error allows them a single
Joshua Little to Moeen Ali, no run, short of length just outside off, Moeen hangs back and punches gently in front of cover

Joshua Little to Moeen Ali, , this takes the splice and still goes for four, adding to Little's misery! Back of a length just outside off, Moeen goes hard on the drive but it climbs on him to hit high on the bat. No timing on it. However, once it finds the gap through point, the ball races away
Joshua Little to Moeen Ali, no run, back of a length outside off, Moeen steers it to point off the back foot
Shami to Gaikwad, no run, 143.8kph, length ball just outside off, Gaikwad gets forward and pushes on the up to cover
Shami to Gaikwad, 1 run, 139.8kph, good length delivery around off, Gaikwad presses forward and knocks it in front of mid-on for a quick single
Shami to Moeen Ali, ,  Good length just outside off, Moeen doesn't move his feet much - if at all - as he goes for the drive, and creams it through extra cover
Shami to Moeen Ali, , oh dear, ! Thankfully the line is just outside off and Moeen is able to arch back to evade. Shami puts his hand up in apology
Shami to Moeen Ali, , ! Pitched up in the slot just outside off, Moeen clears the front leg, has a hefty swing and powers it over the ropes
Shami to Moeen Ali, , back of a length around middle, not all that short but Moeen is still able to pull it through midwicket
Shami to Moeen Ali, , back of a length around middle, not all that short but Moeen is still able to pull it through midwicket
Shami to Moeen Ali, 1 run, Shami follows Moeen as he backs away. It's a length ball into the pads at 142kph, Moeen clips it to deep square leg
Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, no run, that must be close. Rashid on the money first ball with a leg-break that turns in off a length and strikes Moeen on the pad as he misses the sweep! Oh
Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, no run, steps out and drives to mid-off. Idea was to go over the fielder but he got too close to the pitch, hence couldn't get under it
Welcome to the battle of BIG boys, LITTLE!!
Again he's missed a sweep and this time there's no bat involved. But it has pitched outside leg stump
Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, no run,  Again he misses a sweep and this time there's no bat involved. But it has pitched outside leg stump ever so slightly. The decision is reversed!

Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, , dances down, isn't quite to the pitch of this googly but goes through with the shot! And he's somehow able to nail it right off the middle! What a powerful blow down the ground. Rashid stuck his hand out for the catch but the ball was already past him
Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali,  Caught!!

Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali,  Caught by Saha!! Gone! Saha just about hangs onto it! Full outside off, Moeen swings hard looking to go over extra cover but edges it behind as Rashid strikes right back after the boundary.
Rashid Khan to Stokes, 1 run, 97.5kph, full leg-break on off, Stokes gets forward and drives to the left of mid-off who does well to cut it off
Hardik Pandya to Stokes, no run, 139.2kph, good length on leg, and Stokes clips it gently to midwicket
Hardik Pandya to Stokes, 1 run, 139.6kph, back of a length on leg, and it looks like Stokes wants to play this through the off-side. He's cramped for room though and chops it to point

Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, , nowhere near the middle from Gaikwad but it hits the cushions on the full! Pitched up just outside off, Gaikwad seems to be early through the lofted drive and gets it close to the bottom. Still goes for six over extra cover. Oh wait, the umps seem to be checking whether it touched the spider-cam cables on the way. Would be a dead-ball if it did. It's hard to figure it out from the replays and it looks like the six will stand

Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, , six more, and this goes much further! Full outside off, Gaikwad swings through the line, has a bigger flourish than the previous shot and hits it over the long-off boundary
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, no run, fuller than a length around off, and how sweetly has he timed this! But it's straight to mid-off! Lovely drive for no runs
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, no run, fuller than a length around off, and how sweetly has he timed this! But it's straight to mid-off! Lovely drive for no runs

Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, no run, ! He taps this in front of cover and charges for a single, only for Stokes to send him back after taking a few steps down. Gaikwad was already halfway down the pitch. The fielder has a shy and misses
Rashid Khan to Stokes, 1 run, knocks this down to long-on

Looks like a belter of a wicket. Good start by both the sides but with the batting depth CSK has, I believe it has been CSK's powerplay and other thing being neither of Hardik, Shami and Little are gun death overs bowler. Joseph & Yash need to deliver today to make sure CSK don't get enormous score.
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, 1 run, flat leg-break at the stumps, Gaikwad goes back and clips it through midwicket

Rashid Khan to Stokes, , quite full outside off at 96.6kph, Stokes initially back away, then has to reach out and nearly falls over in doing so. But he somehow still generates a lot of power to hammer it down the ground!
Rashid Khan to Stokes,  Caught!!

Rashid Khan to Stokes,  Caught by Saha!! Definite edge there. Yes the finger goes up. Stokes is undone as he misjudges length, and goes back to a leg-break he should've been forward to. It's pushed through flat just outside off, Stokes tries punching it through cover but it skids through sharply, taking a nick to the keeper. Another good catch from Saha.
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, back of a length on middle, Rayudu hangs back and tucks it through midwicket
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, 1 run, googly on middle, turns in off a length and Gaikwad clips it through midwicket
Unnecessary innovations like Spider-cam which interfere with game play should be removed.
Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, , 141.5kph, full delivery slanted into the pads, and Gaikwad effortlessly picks it up and flicks it away for six over long leg! He's just in sublime touch out there!
Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, no run, cracking punch off the back foot, but an equally good stop at backward point by Tewatia diving across
Have to appreciate the brilliant wicketkeeping of Saha.
Have to appreciate the brilliant wicketkeeping of Saha.
Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, no run, close to 147kph, back of a length on middle, and Gaikwad blocks it from the crease

Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, ,  for Gaikwad who sends another one into the stands! The crowd erupts in applause, as do his CSK teammates! Back of a length around the waist, Gaikwad stands tall and pulls it right off the middle. It goes deep into the crowd over square leg
Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, no run, short of length just outside off, Gaikwad dabs it fine but can't beat short third

Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, , another delivery that's on the shorter side but not short enough to trouble Gaikwad! It's neither here nor there, sits up around the tummy and Gaikwad pulls it high in the air. Don't think he middled it like the previous one, but it still goes the distance over square leg
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, back of a length on off, it's a googly turning in and Rayudu punches off the back foot. Good diving stop at short midwicket to cut off the single
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, 94kph, googly outside off, it's slightly short and Rayudu cuts it to deep point
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, 1 run, 97.2kph, follows Gaikwad outside leg stump as he backs away. Gaikwad still tries to cut but mistimes it to backward point
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, 1 run, 97.2kph, follows Gaikwad outside leg stump as he backs away. Gaikwad still tries to cut but mistimes it to backward point
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, knocks it past the diving Rashid for a single
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, no run, full around off, driven to cover
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, no run, googly on middle and leg, Gaikwad backs away to punch through cover but finds the fielder as he's cramped for room
Joshua Little to Rayudu, no run, 140.7kph, full around off, Rayudu gets forward and pushes it to cover
Joshua Little to Rayudu, no run, 139.6kph, back of a length delivery across off stump, and it climbs steeply on Rayudu as he tries punching off the back foot. Goes whistling past the outside edge

Joshua Little to Rayudu, no run, short ball around leg, Rayudu steps across to pull but misses. He's not happy with the umpire's decision of not to call a wide. Players can now review these decisions. But Rayudu doesn't go for it
Joshua Little to Rayudu, 1 run, short of length at the body, around chest level, and Rayudu mistimes the pull through midwicket

Joshua Little to Gaikwad, no run, well done by Little to deceive Gaikwad! Slower length ball on leg, Gaikwad backs away and has to check his shot as he spots the variation late. He defends it back to Little

Joshua Little to Gaikwad, , massive six! He's feasting on this length! Short of length delivery around the chest, Gaikwad swivels across and whacks the pull away over square leg. And it travels a long way! It was a good over until this delivery, with just one run off five balls

Yash Dayal to Rayudu, 1 run,  Rayudu gives charge looking to go over mid-off and slices it in the air. The ball is well wide of Pandya who charges across from mid-off, puts in a full-length dive to his left but it evades him
Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run, driven in the air and goes on the bounce to Pandya at mid-off
Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, , Gaikwad continues in his merry ways! Slower one floated up outside off, Gaikwad spots it, waits for it and swings through the line over mid-off!
Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run, 133kph, good length delivery across off, Gaikwad drives sweetly on the up but it's straight to point
Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, 1 run, slower length ball around off, Gaikwad flicks it through midwicket

Yash Dayal to Rayudu, , now Rayudu joins the party! Slower one around middle and leg, sits up around the waist and Rayudu heaves it over midwicket. Hasn't quite middled it, but has got enough to clear the midwicket boundary
Joshua Little to Gaikwad, 1 run, to point
Joshua Little to Rayudu, 1 run, back of a length on off, Rayudu looks to pull but gets an under-edge onto pad
Joshua Little to Rayudu, 1 run, back of a length on off, Rayudu looks to pull but gets an under-edge onto pad

Oh no, Williamson is in a lot of pain! Excellent effort at the midwicket boundary from him. He catches it and flicks it in the air before going over the ropes. But as he lands, he hurts his right knee

Joshua Little to Gaikwad, , oh no, ! Excellent effort at the midwicket boundary from him. He catches it and flicks it in the air before going over the ropes. But as he lands, he hurts his right knee and seems to be in a lot of trouble. The physio is attending to him outside the boundary. A slower length ball, Gaikwad whacks it across the line, goes flat to Williamson who does so well to toss it back inside before the mishap occurs. The ball rolls into the boundary
Joshua Little to Gaikwad, 1 run, driven to long-off
Joshua Little to Rayudu,  Bowled!!

Joshua Little to Rayudu,  Bowled!! Gives the charge to slog and is cleaned up! A full delivery that tails away, Rayudu looks to swing down the ground but is beaten on the edge. It clatters into the stumps.
Really important that CSK finish well here. It could be Dhoni's day.
Joshua Little to Shivam Dube, no run, pitched up outside off, driven to cover
, still outside the boundary, is helped onto his feet by the physios. It doesn't look good
Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler on middle and leg, Gaikwad clips it through mid-wicket for a single
Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 1 run, banged in short by Alzarri Joseph, sharp bounce as Shivam Dube rides it and pats it towards point
Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, 1 run, drives this crisply to long-off where the fielder stops it with a dive to his right, just a single for Gaikwad
Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, no run, short and quick outside off, 141 kph to be precise, Shivam Dube throws the kitchen sink at it, gets beaten due to the steep bounce
Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, no run, another sharp bouncer by Alzarri Joseph, well-directed and Shivam Dube sways away
Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 1 run, back of a length around middle and leg, Shivam Dube clips it towards the on-side for a single
Hardik Pandya to Shivam Dube, 1 run, short ball on middle and leg, Shivam Dube tucks it to square leg for a single
Hardik Pandya to Shivam Dube, 1 run, short ball on middle and leg, Shivam Dube tucks it to square leg for a single
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, 1 run, another short ball on middle and leg, Gaikwad heaves it through the leg-side for a single

Hardik Pandya to Shivam Dube, leg byes, , not a great delivery by Hardik Pandya. Short ball on leg and it clips Shivam Dube's thigh pad and races away to the fine leg fence in a canter. Hardik Pandya hasn't been up to the mark tonight, and even he knows that
Hardik Pandya to Shivam Dube, 1 run, shorter one around middle and leg, Shivam Dube works it towards the leg-side for a single
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, no run, short of a length around off, knocked in front of cover by Gaikwad
Hardik Pandya to Gaikwad, 1 run, tad fuller on off, driven with ease to long-off, nonchalant single
Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, 1 run, slower one by Alzarri Joseph, Gaikwad drives it to long-on gently
Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, no run, steep bouncer on off, Shivam Dube goes for a pull, gets hit on the shoulder, and probably on the helmet as well
The shots that Ruturaj has been hitting today, the way he's hitting them, make no sense. What an innings.

Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 1 run, 147.4kph, the innings has lost a bit steam since Dube's arrival. Alzarri Joseph goes short and Shivam Dube miscues his pull over the bowler, not timing whatsoever
Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad, 1 run, even Gaikwad has lost a bit momentum since the strategic time-out. On a length around off, Gaikwad lofts it off the cue end towards deep mid-off
Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 2 runs, short one on middle and leg, Shivam Dube hooks it over square leg for a single
Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 2 runs, still no boundary. Makes room and tries to slash it away, mistimes it through cover as the fielder sprints back and flicks it
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, , welcome back into the attack Mr. Rashid. A short ball by him, googly and Gaikwad rocks back to hammer the pull over wide long-on for a flat six
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, 2 runs, whips the short ball over mid-wicket for a brace, good running between the wickets
Some problem with the sightscreen for Gaikwad
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, 1 run, fired down the leg-side, Gaikwad sweeps it to short fine leg where it has been stopped
Rashid Khan to Shivam Dube, byes, 1 run, 98 clicks, quicker leg-break, Shivam Dube swings and misses, was really close to kissing the leg-stump
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, no run, fraction short on off, punched to cover by Gaikwad
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, 1 run, end of a pretty good spell. This was punched to cover by Gaikwad as he scampered across to the bowler's end
Rashid Khan to Gaikwad, 1 run, end of a pretty good spell. This was punched to cover by Gaikwad as he scampered across to the bowler's end
Change of bats for Gaikwad..
NO, IT'S NOT. Gaikwad misses out on his century...
Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad,  Caught!!

Alzarri Joseph to Gaikwad,  Caught by Shubman Gill!! So near, yet so far. That was a pretty high full toss, but just below the waist as confirmed by the third umpire. It was dipping in. Gaikwad was looking to whack that away to the fence, but couldn't middle it. Gill at long-on is quick to charge in as he completes a pretty impressive catch diving forward. End of a spectacular knock for Gaikwad. Some of those shots were simply outstanding. The change of bats results in his downfall.
Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja, 1 run, swiped through the leg-side by Jadeja for a single
Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 1 run, Alzarri Joseph goes short and Shivam Dube goes for the pull, miscues it towards deep mid-wicket
Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja,  Caught!!

Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja,  Caught by Shankar!! Straight to deep mid-wicket. A full length delivery on middle and leg, and Jadeja flicks it stylishly. Gets enough elevation, but not the required distance. Wasn't that easy a catch, but Vijay Shankar stationed near the boundary makes it look like one. Reverse cups it and that's that for RJ for tonight.
Alzarri Joseph to Dhoni, 1 run, hooked through square leg by Dhoni for a single, was a short ball that hurried him

Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 1 run, that's a superb comeback by Alzarri Joseph after conceding 18 runs in his first over. Ends up with a full and quick delivery that Shivam Dube manages to squeeze past the bowler, a single to end the over and he'll retain the strike

Shami to Shivam Dube, 2 runs,  Goes for a pull against this short ball, gets a top edge towards fine leg though. Saha sprints back and puts in a dive, but that's out of his reach, good try by the keeper

Shami to Shivam Dube, , that is what was missing! Shivam Dube finally strikes one, right off the meat. Shami goes short and hammers the pull over the leg-side for a clean six. Would have been one on any ground
Shami to Shivam Dube,  Caught!!

Shami to Shivam Dube,  Caught by Rashid Khan!! Shami's a strike bowler and he'll continue to be one. That's a comeback you can expect from him. Conceded a six against a short ball just on the last ball, and he challenges the batter with another short one. Shivam Dube goes for a pull just like he did on the last ball, but this time he ends up getting a top edge. Straight to Rashid at deep square leg and he's not going to miss out on those.

Shami to Shivam Dube,  Caught by Rashid Khan!! Shami's a strike bowler and he'll continue to be one. That's a comeback you can expect from him. Conceded a six against a short ball just on the last ball, and he challenges the batter with another short one. Shivam Dube goes for a pull just like he did on the last ball, but this time he ends up getting a top edge. Straight to Rashid at deep square leg and he's not going to miss out on those.
Shami to Santner, no run, pats this back to the bowler as Shami cramps him up
Shami to Santner, 1 run, short and quick on middle and leg, nudged to long-on for a single as Santner got cramped for room again
Shami to Dhoni, 1 run, short ball by Shami to end an impressive spell and Dhoni pulls it through the leg-side for a single
Joshua Little to Dhoni, 1 run, width on offer and it has been slashed through cover by MS
Joshua Little to Santner, leg byes, 1 run, fired on leg, a quick full toss that clips Santner's pads and rolls to square leg

Joshua Little to Dhoni, ,  Doesn't disappoint his fans and those chants. Typical Dhoni. Back of a length delivery by Joshua Little and the boss has dispatched this over deep square with a ferocious pull. The crowd goes even louder, even wilder

Joshua Little to Dhoni, , and now Hardik Pandya looks annoyed, not at all happy. This was on the pads and MSD flicked it over square leg for a boundary, no one in the deep so there was no chance to stop it
Joshua Little to Dhoni, no run, slower one outside off, keeps a touch low, Dhoni swings and misses
Joshua Little to Dhoni, 1 run,  Dhoni swipes this over square leg with a powerful pull, but the lack of pace and bounce doesn't allow him to middle it. Just a single to end the innings

A pretty competitive total posted by Chennai Super Kings, but reckon they should have got a lot more than what they actually have. They lost Conway early after put in to bat first, but Gaikwad looked at ease despite his partner's early dismissal. Along with Moeen Ali, Gaikwad dominated the powerplay, but Rashid Khan came into the attack and struck in his first over. He got rid of Moeen and Stokes - both the England all-rounders, however, Gaikwad continued to deal in boundaries. Few of the sixes, the stylish opener struck were out of the world. Gujarat Titans pulled things back to an extent after the second strategic time-out, and that's where CSK lost the momentum. Gaikwad missed out on his century as he was dismissed in the 90s, but it was mainly due to Dube and Rayudu, that CSK couldn't accelerate towards the end. Dhoni played a couple of enterprising shots, but not sure if they will be pleased with the total. Can the Titans chase it down? Join us back in 10 minutes for the second essay to find that out..
Dhoni vs left-arm seam in 20th over (IPL): 362 runs off 150 balls, SR: 241.33, 11 dismissals, 25 fours, 29 sixes.

It's a score which is great to have. Little disappointed. Should've got 15-20 more. Ruturaj was outstanding. It was a decent pitch once you went through your first 5-6 balls. Chennai support has always been outstanding. When I was batting, it felt like the loudest crowd I've experienced in my career.

Welcome back for the run chase folks! It rained last night, so not sure if we'll have any dew that will assist the chasing team. Gill and Saha are walking out in the middle, but it will be interesting to see if Williamson is fit enough to bat tonight. The CSK players are gathered in a huddle with MSD having an animated chat, after a pretty long time. His peptalks have worked wonders in the past. Will the MS magic continue? Let's find out..
Ambati Rayudu is off and Tushar Desphande is the impact player. And here we go! A slip in place for Saha..
Chahar to Saha, no run, shaping away from the batter on off, Saha rides the bounce and taps it towards point. Wanted a single, but Gill wasn't interested..
Chahar to Saha, no run, curving away from the batter outside off, Saha shoulders arms
Chahar to Saha, no run, sharp inswinger on middle, Saha looks to work it through the leg-side, gets hit on the thigh pad
Chahar to Saha, 1 run, on a length outside off, shaping away from the batter, Saha attempts a lofted shot, gets an outside edge towards third man
Chahar to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, Gill is up and running. Wastes no time to get going. A length ball around off and he has square driven this through cover-point for a brace
Chahar to Shubman Gill, no run, back of a length outside off, seams away a touch as Shubman Gill walks out of the crease, has a poke at it and gets beaten

Tushar Deshpande to Saha, ,  Back of a length delivery around middle, slight away seam, Saha looks to swipe it across the line and the top edge flies over third man, just eludes the fielder stationed near the boundary
Tushar Deshpande to Saha, , short ball by Tushar Deshpande, and Saha pulls it over mid-wicket for four runs. Tushar Deshpande gives the batter a stare, but he's the one under pressure

Tushar Deshpande to Saha, leg byes, 1 run, Tushar Deshpande continues to stick to his short ball. Saha tries to nudge that away taking the bottom hand off, gets an inside edge that deflects off the thigh pad to short third man
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, no run, gets a leading edge towards the off-side as the ball straightens off the deck
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, , forehand smash! Stands tall and whips this short of a length delivery through mid-wicket, right into the gap and that's a boundary

Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, no run, short and quick on off, seaming away from the batter with some extra bite, Shubman Gill gets a leading edge towards the off-side as he tries to work it across the line
Chahar to Saha, 1 run, off the inside half towards mid-on for a single
Chahar to Saha, 1 run, off the inside half towards mid-on for a single
Chahar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, played through the leg-side for another single
Chahar to Saha, 1 run, goes for the pull, miscues it towards the on-side
Chahar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, mistimed towards mid-on for another single by Shubman Gill
Chahar to Saha, ,  Saha latches on to it and smokes it over deep square leg with a clean pull shot
Chahar to Saha, 1 run, and now he has pulled this towards the left of square leg for a single to end the end
Impact player impacting the game :)
RS Hangargekar to Saha, no run, appeal for an lbw turned down! A low full toss, almost a yorker. Saha looks to flick acros sthe line, gets an inside edge on to the pads
RS Hangargekar to Saha, , played towards mid-on by Saha, but Hangargekar oversteps and the
RS Hangargekar to Saha, , short ball down the leg-side, Saha looks to pull it away,
RS Hangargekar to Saha, ,  Dispatches the short ball over mid-wicket with a pull and there's no chance of stopping it
RS Hangargekar to Saha, 1 run, driven towards mid-on by Saha off the inside half to his willow
RS Hangargekar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, back of a length around middle and leg, nudged to mid-wicket for a single by Shubman Gill
RS Hangargekar to Saha,  Caught!!

RS Hangargekar to Saha,  Caught by Shivam Dube!! Hangargekar strikes in his first over. Saha flashes away from his body against this length ball and the thick outside edge flies towards square third man. Dube sprints across to his right, keeps his eyes on the ball and completes a fantastic catch diving to his right. Saha is waiting on the sidelines to check out for the replays, but it's a clean catch. The opening partnership has been broken, so we can expect a few more wickets over the next few overs.

RS Hangargekar to Sai Sudharsan, , the impact player is up and running straightaway! Drifting on the pads and Sai Sudharsan times his flick through square leg for a rollicking boundary to open his account
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, ,  All class. Back of a length delivery around off, Shubman Gill stands tall and punches it on the rise through cover for an authoritative boundary
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, ,  All class. Back of a length delivery around off, Shubman Gill stands tall and punches it on the rise through cover for an authoritative boundary
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, 1 run, short of a length around off, Shubman Gill looks to play it on the rise, gets it off the splice towards wide slip
Saha is very underrated in IPL. he is one of the best keepers around if not THE BEST. gives you a quick 30-40 runs up the order . Absolute gold for the price teams have to pay for him.
Tushar Deshpande to Sai Sudharsan, , 1 run, rides the bounce and steers this down to third man. It's a no ball though.
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, , here's the Gilly-copter! On a length around middle and leg, stays put and helicopters it over deep mid-wicket in style
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, no run, short of a length around off, punched to cover by Shubman Gill
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, 1 run, on the pads, Shubman Gill works it to the leg-side for a single
Tushar Deshpande to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, short of a length around middle and leg, nudged to mid-wicket for a single
Santner to Sai Sudharsan, no run, swiped towards mid-wicket by Sai Sudharsan, straight to mid-wicket
Santner to Sai Sudharsan, no run, fraction short outside off, Sai Sudharsan looks to steer it to third man, gets an outside edge that hits MSD's pads
Santner to Sai Sudharsan, no run, short ball on off, punched to cover by Sai Sudharsan
Santner to Sai Sudharsan, , shorter delivery around off, Sai Sudharsan rocks back and spanks it over cover for four runs
Santner to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, short ball on middle and leg, worked through mid-wicket for a single
Santner to Shubman Gill, , fraction short outside off, Shubman Gill rocks back and carves it through backward point to end the powerplay with a boundary
Gavaskar - Tendulkar - Kohli - GILL? (TOO EARLY ?)
Highest Powerplay total for Gujarat Titans
Jadeja to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, on a length around middle and leg, knocked to long-on for a single
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, flatter on middle and leg, worked through the leg-side for a brace. Played it with soft hands, and that's why he could back comfortably
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, no run, on a length outside off, punched to cover by Shubman Gill
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, no run, on a length outside off, punched to cover by Shubman Gill
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, leg byes, 1 run, off the pads and that's a leg bye
Jadeja to Sai Sudharsan, no run, guided back to the bowler by Sai Sudharsan
Jadeja to Sai Sudharsan, 2 runs, quicker through the air outside off, chopped to point where a misfield results in another run
Santner to Shubman Gill, no run, flat and comes in with the arm, Gill defends back to Santner
Santner to Shubman Gill, 1 run, fired in again as Gill danced down. Thick inside edge takes the ball towards deep backward square leg
Santner to Sai Sudharsan, , too short and on the body. Pulled precisely between deep backward square leg and deep mid-wicket. Sai Sudharsan looking confident with each passing stroke...
Santner to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, slower and spins in from outside off, punched towards long-off off the backfoot

The chase going as per plan for GT, the impact player has come out and looked positive. Gill looking confident as ever after such a solid start to this calendar year. CSK need a wicket and they need it quick!
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 1 run, fired full on the pads, clipped towards deep mid-wicket
Jadeja to Sai Sudharsan, 1 run, short, pulled towards deep mid-wicket. Just a single!
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, no run, full and straight, defended to the right of the bowler
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, fired full on off, Gill steps out and punches it towards extra cover. A superb diving effort by Santner to his right, probably saved a couple of runs

Jadeja to Sai Sudharsan, 2 runs, poor delivery. Half tracker on the body!! Pulled behind square but I0$from Conway saves the boundary. Kicks it away with a full stretched leg and then deflects it closer with the other leg. Saves two runs
RS Hangargekar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, full on the pads, clipped uppishly but in control towards deep mid-wicket. Single taken

RS Hangargekar to Sai Sudharsan,  Caught by Dhoni!! Gone!! Soft dismissal!! This was a length ball very wide, was the cutter. Sai Sudharsan went chasing to cut and gets a faint underedge that carries through to Dhoni. Sai Sudharsan has a wry smile on his face for playing at that, would have been wide otherwise...Is this CSK's route back in the game?

RS Hangargekar to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, hard length at the stumps, pulled past the mid-wicket fielder in the cirlce but well stopped by the man in the deep. Two runs to get off the mark for the GT skipper

Jadeja to Shubman Gill, , full and sliding down leg with the arm, Gill gets some bat onto his sweep that takes the ball fine on the leg side. No chance for the fielder in the circle and runs away for four..

Jadeja to Shubman Gill, , wow!! What a hit. This was flat on off, Gill danced out nearly to the pitch of it. Wasn't at it but went through with the inside out slap that goes for a flat six over wide long-off. I0$
Santner to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, short and straying on leg, pulled hard but towards deep backward square leg

Santner to Hardik Pandya, no run, chance? Slow length ball, rolls off the glove and lobs off the top of the pad towards Dhoni. The veteran keeper can't hold on

Jadeja to Hardik Pandya,  Bowled!! Knocked over!! This was a flat delivery on off that zipped through. Pandya goes for a cross batted sweep and the ball skids through before to take out his off stump. Didn't need to play a risky shot, ends up costing him the wicket today.
Jadeja to Shankar, no run, full and straight, Shankar with a thick inside edge on his defence

Jadeja to Shankar, 1 run, short on length, punched towards deep mid-wicket

RS Hangargekar to Shankar, no run, What a stop!! Full outside off, Shankar drives into the ground towards extra cover. Was looking like four but Santner at short cover with a leaping dive to his left plucks it out of thin air
RS Hangargekar to Shankar, , short and on the body, Shankar waits and lets it arrive onto him before pulling to the left of fine leg. Well played!
RS Hangargekar to Shankar, 1 run, short on the body again, has Shankar jumping in defence towards square leg
RS Hangargekar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, short and chasing Gill, pulled towards deep mid-wicket, Just a single

RS Hangargekar to Shankar, 1 run, back of length again, pulled towards deep square for a single
RS Hangargekar to Shubman Gill, , slower bouncer, Gill was early on the pull and top-edges it but luckily for him there is no fine leg in place. The ball ambles away to the fence, another boundary
This final ball has been reviewed by Shubman Gill for being a second bouncer. However, ball was below shoulder and the batter was crouching. We play on, review lost!
This final ball has been reviewed by Shubman Gill for being a second bouncer. However, ball was below shoulder and the batter was crouching. We play on, review lost!
Tushar Deshpande to Shankar, 1 run, good length on off, punched towards the sweeper
Something has to give this over. Dhoni has dangled the carrot by bringing back Deshpande who's been off colour. Will GT try to attack? Because that might be CSK's best chance of a wicket
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, 1 run, length ball onto the thigh pad, clipped towards deep square leg
Tushar Deshpande to Shankar, 2 runs, short pitched, slapped over the bowler's head. Not a clean connection and long-on with cut it off
Tushar Deshpande to Shankar, 1 run, length ball on off, guided down to third-man

Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill, , good length on the pads, pulled through deep mid-wicket. Ruturaj Gaikwad was there in the deep but he was a few yards in. Runs back hurriedly but only parries it over the boundary ropes
Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill,  Caught!!

Tushar Deshpande to Shubman Gill,  Caught by Gaikwad!! Action replay delivery and this time Gill is gone. The GT opener goes for the big slap across the line again, but this time gets more elevation than distance. The elevation helps Gaikwad run in from the boundary ropes and complete a fine pouch.
It's not over till it's over, CSK in the house!!
Out walks the designated finisher Rahul Tewatia!! Unlikely that we'll have a 2 balls, 12 finish today though...
Santner to Shankar, 1 run, short on the body, pulled behind square for a single
Santner to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, flighted up on off. Tewatia defends to point for a single
Santner to Shankar, , slow outside off, slapped between deep extra cover and long-off. Both fielders ran towards it and then stopped to look at each other's faces, gifting Shankar a boundary!!
Santner to Shankar, 1 run, quicker on off, driven towards deep extra
Santner to Rahul Tewatia, no run, slow outside off, was there to be hit but Tewatia misses on the cut
Santner to Rahul Tewatia, no run, flighted up and straight, defended to the leg side
Santner to Rahul Tewatia, no run, flighted up and straight, defended to the leg side

CSK could do with a break and some pearls of wisdom from MSD and the rest of the management. 34 needed off the final four overs, sensible cricket and GT can get home. CSK need some mad inspiration from somewhere to turn this game. Let's see how the game proceeds...
Chahar to Shankar, 1 run, slow and into the pitch, turned towards short fine for a single
Chahar to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, on a length and straight, pushed towards long-on
Chahar to Shankar, no run, full and straight, blocked towards mid-off. Dot ball!
Chahar to Shankar, 1 run, good length on middle and leg, Shankar backed away and punches it past the infield towards the sweeper
Chahar to Rahul Tewatia, no run, short outside off, punched towards extra cover.
Chahar to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, pace off and short outside off, slapped towards the sweeper
A wicket and this can get very interesting!! Big over coming up for the 20-year-old Hangargekar!!
RS Hangargekar to Rahul Tewatia, no run, full and angles outside off, Tewatia takes a big swing and misses. Loud cheer to greet the dot ball!
RS Hangargekar to Rahul Tewatia, no run, full and wide, driven hard but towards mid-off. Pressure building...
RS Hangargekar to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, yorker length on off, pushed towards mid-off for a risky single. Tewatia makes it home but the throw was also wide

RS Hangargekar to Shankar, , Hangargekar goes short, Vijay Shankar read the length yesterday and was ready deep in his crease with a side-on stance to whack it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. Big six!!!

RS Hangargekar to Shankar, no run, full toss outside off. Looked high and pretty wide as well, but umpire doesn't call wide. Vijay Shankar reviews it Hangargekar gets away with it. Just inside the wide line (debatable) and the on-field decision stays!
RS Hangargekar to Shankar,  Caught!!

RS Hangargekar to Shankar,  Caught by Santner!! Big, big wicket!! What an IPL debut this young kid is having. This was an attempted yorker, falls marginally short and Shankar tries to dig it over the infield. Gets enough elevation but not the distance, and a back-tracking Santner always had eyes on the ball to complete a superb reverse cup.
Chahar to Rahul Tewatia, no run, full outside off, a swing and a miss for Tewatia
Chahar to Rahul Tewatia, no run, full outside off, a swing and a miss for Tewatia
Chahar to Rahul Tewatia, no run, full outside off, a swing and a miss for Tewatia
Chahar to Rahul Tewatia, leg byes, , attempted yorker, deflects off the boots and runs away past MS Dhoni's full length dive to his right. Boundary to fine leg!

Chahar to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, short outside off, pulled towards deep mid-wicket. Just a single!!
Chahar to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, short outside off, pulled towards deep mid-wicket. Just a single!!

Chahar to Rashid Khan, , Oh my goodness!! This was a slower one that was pitched up, Rashid Khan clears his front leg and gives it an almighty slog over deep mid-wicket. That was his first ball, would you believe it?

Chahar to Rashid Khan, , Oh my goodness!! This was a slower one that was pitched up, Rashid Khan clears his front leg and gives it an almighty slog over deep mid-wicket. That was his first ball, would you believe it?
Just to remind, the inexperienced Tushar Despande has to bowl the final over. So runs need to be given to him to protect
Just to remind, the inexperienced Tushar Despande has to bowl the final over. So runs need to be given to him to protect
Chahar to Rashid Khan, , short on off, Rashid Khan gets it off the bottom and it flies over short third for a boundary. One bounce and into the fence. Game sealed?
Chahar to Rashid Khan, , short on off, Rashid Khan gets it off the bottom and it flies over short third for a boundary. One bounce and into the fence. Game sealed?
Chahar to Rashid Khan, no run, slower bouncer, flummoxed Rashid Khan who swings and misses
Chahar to Rashid Khan, no run, slower bouncer, flummoxed Rashid Khan who swings and misses
Down to the final over, ofcourse it had to in the IPL. How's your bottle, Tushar Deshpande?
Down to the final over, ofcourse it had to in the IPL. How's your bottle, Tushar Deshpande?
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul Tewatia, , full outside off, a swing and a miss from Rahul Tewatia but it was too wide. One more run chalked off the target
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul Tewatia, , full outside off, a swing and a miss from Rahul Tewatia but it was too wide. One more run chalked off the target

Tushar Deshpande to Rahul Tewatia, , that should seal it!! This was full outside off, Tewatia shuffled across his stumps, gets under the ball and hoists his drive over mid-off. Sails all the way for six. Scores are level

Tushar Deshpande to Rahul Tewatia, , that should seal it!! This was full outside off, Tewatia shuffled across his stumps, gets under the ball and hoists his drive over mid-off. Sails all the way for six. Scores are level

Tushar Deshpande to Rahul Tewatia, , he's done it again!! New season, same old Rahul Tewatia. Tushar Deshpande dishes out a yorker, Tewatia slams it straight as an arrow down the ground for four. Didn't even bother running, points his fingers towards the sky and then extends his arms in celebration, as if to ask if the game was ever in doubt with him in the middle!! The Champions are off to a winning start...

Tushar Deshpande to Rahul Tewatia, , he's done it again!! New season, same old Rahul Tewatia. Tushar Deshpande dishes out a yorker, Tewatia slams it straight as an arrow down the ground for four. Didn't even bother running, points his fingers towards the sky and then extends his arms in celebration, as if to ask if the game was ever in doubt with him in the middle!! The Champions are off to a winning start...

A familiar story for Gujarat Titans, in so many ways as they start their title defence on a winning note. Earlier in the day, Ruturaj Gaikwad played a classy innings to get everyone excited about the IPL. He fell eight short of a hundred, but his efforts helped CSK post 178 for the first innings. In reply, Gujarat got off to a flier as the first ever impact substitute Tushar Deshpande was shown the roof by Wriddhi Saha. His cameo ended within the powerplay, but that set the tone for the innings. Shubman Gill took on the role of the anchor, and played a few expansive shots here and there, as the rest accelarated. GT got handy contributions from their impact substitute Sai Sudharshan - who came on for an injured Williamson, and Vijay Shankar. They lost two quick wickets at the death as CSK's debutant Hangargekar impressed with a three-fer, but who else but Rahul Tewatia to seal the game with his trademark finishing cameo? And not to forget that six and four from Rashid Khan who continues to be a thorn with the bat as well. Now on the presentations...

In reply, Gujarat got off to a flier as the first ever impact substitute Tushar Deshpande was shown the roof by Wriddhi Saha. His cameo ended within the powerplay, but that set the tone for the innings. Shubman Gill took on the role of the anchor, and played a few expansive shots here and there, as the rest accelarated. GT got handy contributions from their impact substitute Sai Sudharshan - who came on for an injured Williamson, and Vijay Shankar. And not to forget that six and four from Rashid Khan who continues to be a thorn with the bat as well. Now on the presentations...

Felt pretty good. Little bit disappointed with myself for getting out. But getting off to a good start is very important for the team. Definitely makes a difference when you've got runs under your belt at International level. Wicket is so good as a batsman. Don't have to overhit, just have to time it well and it flies. No specific roles given to us. It's just about who gets set. We have to play the situation. Today we were chasing not a very high score, but a high-ish total. So the intent from Wriddhi bhai was to get as many runs as possible in the powerplay.

Felt pretty good. Little bit disappointed with myself for getting out. But getting off to a good start is very important for the team. Definitely makes a difference when you've got runs under your belt at International level. Wicket is so good as a batsman. Don't have to overhit, just have to time it well and it flies. No specific roles given to us. It's just about who gets set. We have to play the situation. Today we were chasing not a very high score, but a high-ish total. So the intent from Wriddhi bhai was to get as many runs as possible in the powerplay.

We all knew there will be dew. We could have done a bit more with the batsman ship. Ruturaj (Gaikwad) was brilliant, he times the ball well and he's a pleasure to watch. The way he picks his options, it is pleasing to watch. I think it's important for the youngsters to step in. I think Raj  (Hangargekar) has pace and he will get better with time. Think the bowlers will get better, a no-ball is something that's in your control, so you need to work on that. I felt two left armers will be a better option so I went ahead with them. Shivam was an option, but I felt comfortable with the bowlers overall.

We all knew there will be dew. We could have done a bit more with the batsman ship. Ruturaj (Gaikwad) was brilliant, he times the ball well and he's a pleasure to watch. The way he picks his options, it is pleasing to watch. I think it's important for the youngsters to step in. I think Raj  (Hangargekar) has pace and he will get better with time. Think the bowlers will get better, a no-ball is something that's in your control, so you need to work on that. I felt two left armers will be a better option so I went ahead with them. Shivam was an option, but I felt comfortable with the bowlers overall.

Obviously very happy. We did put ourselves in a difficult situation but Rahul and Rashid did very well. We were happy at the mid-innings because at one point they looked like getting 200, but we got those couple of wickets to pull things back. Having this Impact rule makes my job difficult. I have too many options, and because of this someone will bowl less. This game I realised bowling hard lengths was the way to go, that's why Alzarri bowled late. Having Rashid is a real asset, he will get you wickets and get you some runs late down the order as well. But today my shot and Shubman's shot wasn't the best, we need to do better to ensure we don't put the responsibility on these guys lower down.

Obviously very happy. We did put ourselves in a difficult situation but Rahul and Rashid did very well. We were happy at the mid-innings because at one point they looked like getting 200, but we got those couple of wickets to pull things back. Having this Impact rule makes my job difficult. I have too many options, and because of this someone will bowl less. This game I realised bowling hard lengths was the way to go, that's why Alzarri bowled late. Having Rashid is a real asset, he will get you wickets and get you some runs late down the order as well. But today my shot and Shubman's shot wasn't the best, we need to do better to ensure we don't put the responsibility on these guys lower down.

So happy to get this crucial Man of the Match. Will give me a lot of the energy for the rest of the competition. I try to do my best in all three formats, and give it all in the practice sessions. The plan is hard to bowl to lefties, but the idea was to keep it tight and I knew in my mind that if I keep it simple and get two wickets, we will be back in the game. I knew if I kept it simple we will get the results. ( On batting improvement) It is all thanks to the time we spend in the nets, and the confidence given to me by the coaching staff and captain Hardik. I've been batting a lot and the results are there to see.

That concludes a very entertaining IPL opener. A sense of deja vu as GT find a way to win these tight games with their iceman Rahul Tewatia delivering in the end. And Shubman Gill giving them a good start, and how can we ever look beyond the consistency of Rashid Khan. A sense of deja vu for CSK as well as their death bowling continues to haunt them. Has it really been one year since the last IPL? Because not much has changed... Let's see what further similarities we get in tomorrow's double header, starting with a game between Punjab Kings and KKR. For now, this is  signing off on behalf of  and  That's all from the IPL 2023 opener. Ciao!
